hypothesis_content.title: Neutral Regime BTC Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC is in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence >60%) and its 10-day realized volatility falls below its 30-day average while price trades within a 5% range for 7+ days, a breakout above the 20-day high will lead to a mean reversion to the 50-day moving average within 5 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes often exhibit volatility compression before directional moves. Low volatility + range-bound trading suggests accumulation. Breakout on volume indicates institutional participation resuming trend.
entry_conditions: BTC price range (high-low) <5% over last 7 days
BTC breaks above 20-day high on >10% volume spike
hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout fails to reach 50-day SMA within 5 days OR price immediately reverses below breakout level
